intro: Cheniella quinnanensis subsp. gandhiana, commonly known as the Quinnanensis Gandhiana, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
